pullRequest.title: Implementing Azure Descriptor Actions
pullRequest.bodyText: Implementing the Azure Board actions. There are a few TODO tickets such as in AzureBoardsTestIssueRequestCreator where the class is a duplicate. For those I will create a ticket to update those classes to be more general in 6.3.0 or later.

commit.message: feat: Initial commit for creating AzureBoards action classes
refactor: Merging in partial work for implementing AzureBoardDistributionTestAction
feature: Implement cleanup for azure work items and implement the delete work item endpoint
feat: Implement AzureBoardsGlobalTestAction and add header info
fix: Fix authorization requests error null errors

nodes.bodyText: I'm not 100% sure we care about parsing the response in delete requests. Is there typically a body?
I think this might be true for Jira, but it might not be in Azure. I think the OAuth user is likely the default creator and we may not need to explicitly set it.
I believe Azure has its own IssueSearchProperties. We definitely should not be using the Jira ones.
This method should be moved into a new utility class regardless of Azure's use of it.

nodes.bodyText: Is this message true for both exceptions? We might consider exposing the exception message if it is an AlertException (i.e. have separate catch blocks).
What's the plan with this class? Is this class extended somewhere? Should all these methods be protected?
if getProjectFieldKey ends up becoming a private method, you can add the FieldAccessor as a parameter then do all this within the method instead of here.
This is a good example of the comment I made on line 79
Do we want to be returning null? If we want null, I think returning an optional may be better.
Can we add a constructor that passes null for you and takes a single argument?
This could use the single constructor

commit.message: refactor: Create utility classes and update AzureBoardsContext factory based on PR feedback
refactor: Change TestIssueRequestCreator to return an optional and update AlertIssueOrigin constructor
refactor: Update Proxy to ProxyInfo to resolve conflicts in 6.2.0
